The definition of radius is the distance from the centre of a circle to any point in its circumference. Looking at it the other way round, a circle is the set of all points a certain fixed distance (the radius) from another point, called the circle's centre. So the two things you mention in your question are equivalent.

By definition, a circle is the set of all points that are equidistant to a specific point, called the center of the circle. The distance from all points of the circle to its center is called the circle’s radius.
That's how radius of a circle is defined ! Radius is defined as the distance between the center and any point on the circumference.
